text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Vysočina Region | native_name = Kraj Vysočina | native_name_lang = cs | settlement_type = Region | image_skyline = Trebic vnitrni mesto hradek.jpg | image_flag = Flag of Vysocina Region.svg | flag_size = | image_shield = Vysocina Region CoA CZ.svg | shield_size = | image_map = Kraj Vysocina in Czech Republic.svg | mapsize = | map_alt = | map_caption = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Czech Republic | seat_type = Capital | seat = Jihlava | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 6795.56 | elevation_m = | elevation_max_m = 837 | elevation_min_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 509274 | population_as_of = 2019-01-01 | population_density_km2 = auto | iso_code = CZ-VY | registration_plate = J | website = www.kr-vysocina.cz }} The Vysočina Region is an administrative unit (kraj) of the Czech Republic. The capital city is Jihlava. The region is the location of two mountain ranges, Žďárské vrchy and Jihlavské vrchy. It also has three UNESCO World Heritage Sites: the historical centre of Telč, the Pilgrimage Church of Saint John of Nepomuk in Žďár nad Sázavou, and the Jewish Quarter and St Procopius' Basilica in Třebíč. ==Administrative divisions== The Vysočina Region is divided into 5 districts: ==References==
title: Vysočina Region
